The NOvA Experiment
The NOvA
Experiment

• NOvA is a second generation
• NOvA is a second generation

experiment on the NuMI beamline which is optimized for the detection of νμ→νe and νμ→νe oscillations

which is optimized for the detection

• NOvA is:

NOvA searches for electron neutrino appearance down to ~0.01 at 90% CL

2) Do neutrino oscillations violate CP?
2) Do neutrino oscillations
violate CP?

NOvA provides the first look into the CPV parameter space
NOvA provides the first look into the
CPV parameter space

sensitive to the mass ordering

4) Is θ23 maximal? Because of its excellent energy resolution NOvA can make ~1% measurements of muon neutrino disappearance using quasi- elastic channel

NOvA can make ~1% measurements of
muon neutrino disappearance using quasi-
elastic channel

5) Are neutrinos their own antiparticles?
5) Are neutrinos their
own antiparticles?

Avignonee, Elliott, Engel, arXiv:0708.1033
Avignonee, Elliott, Engel, arXiv:0708.1033

If NOvA establishes inverted hierarchy and next generation of 0νββ experiments see nothing, then it is very likely that neutrinos are Dirac particles
If NOvA establishes inverted hierarchy
and next generation of 0νββ experiments
see nothing, then it is very likely that
neutrinos are Dirac particles

NOvA’s granularity allows for clean neutral-current measurements facilitating searches for sterile neutrinos
NOvA’s granularity allows for clean
neutral-current measurements
facilitating searches for sterile neutrinos

• FY2008 omnibus budget passed by Congress in December of 2007 zeroed funding for NOvA in FY08. Formally closed the project office, but we able to make some progress with small amount of FY07 carryover and with university groups.

• FY08 funding required new cost and schedule to be drafted and reviewed. Those reviews passed in April and June of 2008. Expect CD2 process to be complete in August of this year.

reviews passed in April and June of 2008. Expect CD2 process to be complete in
August of this year.

• Emergency funding bill passed by Congress passed this month. Included $62.5M additional funding for HEP. NOvA is funded at $9.5M for this fiscal year. Project office officially reopened. $9.5M is enough to complete roughly 3/4 of the remaining design and R&D tasks in our schedule.

NOvA is the foundation of the US accelerator neutrino program
NOvA is the foundation of the US accelerator
neutrino program

• It addresses 7 of the 8 physics questions called out by P5 as the focus of the neutrino program over the next decade
• It addresses 7 of the 8 physics questions called out by P5
as the focus of the neutrino program over the next
decade

• Among the next generation experiments, NOvA uniquely provides information on the mass hierarchy and CP phase
• Among the next generation experiments, NOvA
uniquely provides information on the mass
hierarchy and CP phase

• NOvA provides the incentive and continuity to increase the NuMI beam power from 400 to 700 kW and ultimately to 2.3 MW
• NOvA provides the incentive and continuity
to increase the NuMI beam power from
400 to 700 kW and ultimately to
2.3 MW

• Ensures a robust future program.
• Ensures a robust future program.
